data.scheme_name: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs - Net SGST reimbursement to MSMEs - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provide reimbursement of net SGST up to 100% of net SGST for 10 years upto 7.5% of eligible Fixed Capital Investment per annum.
data.eligibility:
1. A existing enterprise that expands or diversifies and begins commercial production or services within the scheme's operative period will be eligible for the scheme.
  2. Enterprises that have already received incentives for the same Gross Fixed Capital Investment (GFCI) from any state government scheme or agency are ineligible for this scheme, unless specifically permitted.
  3. For final eligibility, the lower of the actual GFCI in the project or the cost appraised by the bank or financial institution will be considered.
data.conditions:
1. Eligible enterprise can register under GST for eligible product manufacturing only.
  2. MSME with multiple units must maintain separate accounts for this scheme, certified by a Chartered Accountant.
  3. Incentives applicable only to goods manufactured on eligible enterprise premises, not on resale. 
  4. Misrepresentation of inter-State sales as intra-State sales leads to cancellation of eligibility and repayment of incentives with interest. 
  5. Eligible enterprise submits reimbursement details to MSME Commissioner, certified by a Chartered Accountant, declaring no misrepresentation of sales. 
  6. Disbursing Authority provides quarterly reimbursement. 
  7. Enterprise shall have to furnish information regarding production, sales, turnover and employment, etc. annually to concerned DIC before end of September each year. 
  8. An enterprise shall be required to employ persons domiciled in Gujarat to the extent of atleast 85% of its total number of employees in all categories. 
  9. The employment of persons domiciled in Gujarat in managerial and supervisory capacity shall not be less than 60% of the number of persons employed.
  10. If an enterprise is located in the geographical limit of more than one taluka, then the taluka in which the enterprise has the largest percentage of land area will be considered.
data.beneficiaries:
1. A existing enterprise that expands or diversifies and begins commercial production or services within the scheme's operative period will be eligible for the scheme. 
  2. Enterprises that have already received incentives for the same Gross Fixed Capital Investment (GFCI) from any state government scheme or agency are ineligible for this scheme, unless specifically permitted.
  3. For final eligibility, the lower of the actual GFCI in the project or the cost appraised by the bank or financial institution will be considered.
data.prerequisites:
1. Eligible enterprise can register under GST for eligible product manufacturing only. 
  2. MSME with multiple units must maintain separate accounts for this scheme, certified by a Chartered Accountant. 
  3. Incentives applicable only to goods manufactured on eligible enterprise premises, not on resale. 
  4. Misrepresentation of inter-State sales as intra-State sales leads to cancellation of eligibility and repayment of incentives with interest.
  5. Eligible enterprise submits reimbursement details to MSME Commissioner, certified by a Chartered Accountant, declaring no misrepresentation of sales. 
  6. Disbursing Authority provides quarterly reimbursement. 
  7. Enterprise shall have to furnish information regarding production, sales, turnover and employment, etc. annually to concerned DIC before end of September each year. 
  8. An enterprise shall be required to employ persons domiciled in Gujarat to the extent of atleast 85% of its total number of employees in all categories. 
  9. The employment of persons domiciled in Gujarat in managerial and supervisory capacity shall not be less than 60% of the number of persons employed.
  10. If an enterprise is located in the geographical limit of more than one taluka, then the taluka in which the enterprise has the largest percentage of land area will be considered.
data.context: The Scheme is launched to boost MSME growth and strengthen the overall ecosystem in the State and help achieve the larger goal of an Atmanirbhar Gujarat for Atmanirbhar Bharat.
data.objective: To provide reimbursement of net SGST to MSMEs for ease of doing business.
data.description:
The eligible enterprise will be eligible for reimbursement of net SGST based on the taluka category of the project subject to following ceilings: 

  • Category 1 - 100% of net SGST for 10 years upto 7.5% of eligible Fixed Capital Investment per annum. 
  • Category 2 - 90% of net SGST for 10 years upto 6.5% of eligible Fixed Capital Investment per annum. 
  • Category 3 - 80% of net SGST for 10 years upto 5% of eligible Fixed Capital Investment per annum. The period of 10 years shall be from the date of commencement of commercial production.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply online within one year from the date of the first disbursement of the loan, or on or before the date of commencement of commercial production, whichever is later.
data.funding_facilitator:
Micro, Small : General Manager - DIC
Medium : MSME Commissioner
data.funding_mechanism: Reimbursement of the net SGST will be made after the commencement of commercial production of the enterprise.
data.additional_info:
General Assistance Guidelines: - Enterprises that receive assistance under this component are ineligible for similar benefits under other state government schemes. - Eligibility for Government of India schemes remains intact even if assistance is availed from the state. Categories of Locations for Subsidy: 

  1. Category I: Includes areas such as: Dholera, Detroj - Rampura, Dhanduka, Khamba, Dhari, Lilia, Savar Kundla, Babra, Kunkavav Vadia, Lathi, Tarapur, Anklav, Sojitra, Dhansura, Malpur, Lakhani, Amirgadh, Suigam, Danta, Dhanera, Vav, Kankrej, Vadgam, Tharad, Deodar, Dantiwada, Netrang, Jesar, Umrala, Vallabhipur, Gariadhar, Palitana, Talaja, Ghogha, Ranpur, Gadhada, Barwala, Botad, Chhota Udepur, Kavant, Nasvadi, Sankheda, Bodeli, Jetpur Pavi, Kalyanpur, Bhanvad, Dhanpur, Sanjeli, Limkheda, Dahod, Fatepura, Jhalod, Singvad, Garbada, Devgadbaria, Gir Gadhada, Talala, Jodiya, Bhesan, Mendarda, Rapar, Nakhatrana, Lakhpat, Mandvi, Galteshwar, Matar, Vaso, Mahudha, Satlasana, Jotana, Kheralu, Becharaji, Vadnagar, Khanpur, Kadana, Virpur, Maliya, Garudeshwar, Dediapada, Tilakwada, Sagbara, Khergam, Ghoghamba, Morwa (Hadaf), Jambughoda, Shehera, Sarasvati, Santalpur, Shankheshwar, Sami, Radhanpur, Harij. 
  2. Category II: Includes areas such as: Viramgam, Rajula, Bagasara, Amreli, Umreth, Kambhat, Borsad, Petlad, Meghraj, Bayad, Bhiloda, Modasa, Deesa, Bhabhar, Palanpur, Amod, Jambusar, Valia, Mahuva, Sihor. 3. 
  3. Category III: Includes areas such as: Daskroi, Bavla, Dholka, Sanand, Mandal, Ahmedabad City, Anand, Jhagadia, Bharuch, Vagra, Anklesvar, Hansot, Bhavnagar, Khambalia, Kalol, Dehgam, Ghandinagar, Lalpur, Jamnagar, Junagadh, Junagadh City, Mundra, Anjar, Gandhidham, Kheda, Nadiad, Kadi, Mehsana, Wankaner, Morbi, Tankara, Navsari, Halol.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Signed copy of Application form
2. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
3. Copy of the Constitution of the enterprise 
4. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise 
5. Copy of PAN Card of Applicant/Promoters/Directors/partners and authorised signatory 
6. CA certificate for capital investment 
7. Land Document such as NA Permission/ copy of Index/sale deed 
8. Estimates of Power Distribution company (DISCOM) and receipt 
9. Copy of bills issued by Power Distribution company 
10. Copy of Power Distribution License company Certificate (High Tension / Low Tension) 
11. Copy of certificate for social category (if applicable) 
12. Copy of CA Certified Balance Sheet of the latest (if applicable) 
13. Copy of CA certified Shareholding pattern 
14. Copy of sanctioned and connected Load Certificate issued by Power Distribution License Company 
15. Self-certified expenditure statement supported by DISCOM documents 
16. Copy of GPCB approved NOC/Consent & other departments approval (if applicable) 
17. Bank details for payment (Cancelled cheque) 
18. Copy of GST registration (if applicable) 
19. Self-Attested documents/ details to be submitted by the Authorized Person 
20. Power of attorney/Board resolution/ Consent letter 
21. Supporting documents for SC/ST Enterprise
data.checklist_info_d:
